    ì£¼ì˜: ë¹ˆ ì´ë¦„ì€ í•­ìƒ ë‹¤ë¥¸ ì´ë¦„ì„ ë¶€ì—¬í•´ì•¼ í•¨. ê°™ì€ ì´ë¦„ì„ ë¶€ì—¬í•˜ë©´, ë‹¤ë¥¸ ë¹ˆì´ ë¬´ì‹œë˜ê±°ë‚˜, ê¸°ì¡´ ë¹ˆì„ ë®ì–´ë²„ë¦¬ê±°ë‚˜ ì„¤ì •ì— ë”°ë¼ ì˜¤ë¥˜ê°€ ë°œìƒ

    • ì„¤ì • ì •ë³´ë¥¼ ì°¸ê³ í•˜ì—¬ ì˜ì¡´ê´€ê³„ ì£¼ì…(Dependency Injection)

ì»¨í…Œì´ë„ˆì— ë“±ë¡ëœ ëª¨ë“  ë¹ˆ ì¡°íšŒ

  • ëª¨ë“  ë¹ˆ ì¶œë ¥

    @Test
@DisplayName("ëª¨ë“  ë¹ˆ ì¶œë ¥")
void findAllBeans() {
    String[] beanDefinitionNames = ac.getBeanDefinitionNames();
    for (String beanDefinitionName : beanDefinitionNames) {
        Object bean = ac.getBean(beanDefinitionName);
        System.out.println("bean = " + bean);
    }
}

  • ì• í”Œë¦¬ì¼€ì´ì…˜ ë¹ˆ ì¶œë ¥

    @Test
@DisplayName("ì• í”Œë¦¬ì¼€ì´ì…˜ ë¹ˆ ì¶œë ¥")
void findApplicationBeans() {
    String[] beanDefinitionNames = ac.getBeanDefinitionNames();
    for (String beanDefinitionName : beanDefinitionNames) {
        BeanDefinition beanDefinition = ac.getBeanDefinition(beanDefinitionName);
        if (beanDefinition.getRole() == BeanDefinition.ROLE_APPLICATION) {
            Object bean = ac.getBean(beanDefinitionName);
            System.out.println("bean = " + bean);
        }
    }
}

    • getRole() ë¡œ êµ¬ë¶„ ê°€ëŠ¥

      • ROLE_APPLICATION : ì‚¬ìš©ìê°€ ì •ì˜í•œ ë¹ˆ
      • ROLE_INFRASCTUCTURE : ìŠ¤í”„ë§ì´ ë‚´ë¶€ì—ì„œ ì‚¬ìš©í•˜ëŠ” ë¹ˆ

ìŠ¤í”„ë§ ë¹ˆ ì¡°íšŒ - ê¸°ë³¸

  • ac.getBean(name, type)
  • ac.getBean(type)

  • ì¡°íšŒ ëŒ€ìƒ ì—†ìœ¼ë©´ NoSuchBeanDefinitionException ë°œìƒ

    @Test
@DisplayName("ë¹ˆ ì´ë¦„ìœ¼ë¡œ ì¡°íšŒ X")
void findBeanByNameX(){
    // when
    Throwable throwable = catchThrowable(() -> ac.getBean("xxx", MemberService.class));
    // then
    assertThat(throwable)
        .isInstanceOf(NoSuchBeanDefinitionException.class);
}

ìŠ¤í”„ë§ ë¹ˆ ì¡°íšŒ - ë™ì¼í•œ íƒ€ì…ì´ ë‘˜ ì´ìƒ

  • íƒ€ì…ìœ¼ë¡œ ì¡°íšŒ ì‹œ ê°™ì€ íƒ€ì…ì˜ ë¹ˆì´ ë‘˜ ì´ìƒì´ë©´ NoUniqueBeanDefinitionException ì˜¤ë¥˜ ë°œìƒ

    @Test
@DisplayName("íƒ€ì…ìœ¼ë¡œ ì¡°íšŒ ì‹œ ê°™ì€ íƒ€ì…ì´ ë‘˜ ì´ìƒì´ë©´, ì¤‘ë³µ ì˜¤ë¥˜ ë°œìƒ")
void findBeanByTypeDuplicateTest() {
    // when
    Throwable throwable = catchThrowable(() -> ac.getBean(MemberRepository.class));
    // then
    assertThat(throwable).isInstanceOf(NoUniqueBeanDefinitionException.class);
}

  • getBeansOfType() ìœ¼ë¡œ í•´ë‹¹ íƒ€ì…ì˜ ëª¨ë“  ë¹ˆ ì¡°íšŒ ê°€ëŠ¥

    @Test
@DisplayName("íŠ¹ì • íƒ€ì… ì „ì²´ ì¡°íšŒ")
void findAllBeansByType() {
    // given
    Map<String, MemberRepository> beansOfType = ac.getBeansOfType(MemberRepository.class);
    // when
    for (String key : beansOfType.keySet()) {
        System.out.println("key = " + key + " value" + beansOfType.get(key));
    }
    // then
    assertThat(beansOfType).hasSize(2);
}

ìŠ¤í”„ë§ ë¹ˆ ì¡°íšŒ - ìƒì† ê´€ê³„

  • ë¶€ëª¨ íƒ€ì…ìœ¼ë¡œ ì¡°íšŒí•˜ë©´ ìì‹ íƒ€ì…ë„ í•¨ê»˜ ì¡°íšŒ

    @Test
@DisplayName("ë¶€ëª¨ íƒ€ì…ìœ¼ë¡œ ì¡°íšŒ ì‹œ, ìì‹ì´ ë‘˜ ì´ìƒ ìˆìœ¼ë©´, ì¤‘ë³µ ì˜¤ë¥˜ ë°œìƒ")
void findBeanByParentTypeDuplicateTest() {
    // when
    Throwable throwable = catchThrowable(() -> ac.getBean(DiscountPolicy.class));
    // then
    assertThat(throwable).isInstanceOf(NoUniqueBeanDefinitionException.class);
}

BeanFactoryì™€ ApplicationContext

  • BeanFactory

    • ìŠ¤í”„ë§ ì»¨í…Œì´ë„ˆ ìµœìƒìœ„ ì¸í„°í˜ì´ìŠ¤
    • ìŠ¤í”„ë§ ë¹ˆì„ ê´€ë¦¬í•˜ê³  ì¡°íšŒ
    • getBean() ì œê³µ

  • ApplicationContext

    • BeanFactory ê¸°ëŠ¥ì„ ëª¨ë‘ ìƒì† ë°›ì•„ ì œê³µ

    • ë©”ì‹œì§€ì†ŒìŠ¤ë¥¼ í™œìš©í•œ êµ­ì œí™” ê¸°ëŠ¥

      • ì˜ˆë¥¼ ë“¤ì–´ì„œ í•œêµ­ì—ì„œ ë“¤ì–´ì˜¤ë©´ í•œêµ­ì–´ë¡œ, ì˜ì–´ê¶Œì—ì„œ ë“¤ì–´ì˜¤ë©´ ì˜ì–´ë¡œ ì¶œ

    • í™˜ê²½ë³€ìˆ˜

      • ë¡œì»¬, ê°œë°œ, ìš´ì˜ë“±ì„ êµ¬ë¶„í•´ì„œ ì²˜ë¦¬

    • ì• í”Œë¦¬ì¼€ì´ì…˜ ì´ë²¤íŠ¸

      • ì´ë²¤íŠ¸ë¥¼ ë°œí–‰í•˜ê³  êµ¬ë…í•˜ëŠ” ëª¨ë¸ì„ í¸ë¦¬í•˜ê²Œ ì§€ì›

    • í¸ë¦¬í•œ ë¦¬ì†ŒìŠ¤ ì¡°íšŒ

      • íŒŒì¼, í´ë˜ìŠ¤íŒ¨ìŠ¤, ì™¸ë¶€ ë“±ì—ì„œ ë¦¬ì†ŒìŠ¤ë¥¼ í¸ë¦¬í•˜ê²Œ ì¡°íšŒ
  • BeanFactory ë¥¼ ì§ì ‘ ì‚¬ìš©í•  ì¼ì€ ê±°ì˜ ì—†ìŒ
  • BeanFactory ë‚˜ ApplicationContextë¥¼ ìŠ¤í”„ë§ ì»¨í…Œì´ë„ˆë¼ í•¨

ë‹¤ì–‘í•œ ì„¤ì • í˜•ì‹ ì§€ì› - JAVA, XML

  • ìŠ¤í”„ë§ ì»¨í…Œì´ë„ˆëŠ” ë‹¤ì–‘í•œ í˜•ì‹ì˜ ì„¤ì • ì •ë³´ë¥¼ ì½ì„ ìˆ˜ ìˆë„ë¡ ìœ ì—°í•˜ê²Œ ì„¤ê³„

ìŠ¤í”„ë§ ë¹ˆ ì„¤ì • ë©”íƒ€ì •ë³´ - BeanDefinition

  • BeanDefinition ì •ë³´

    • BeanClassName: ìƒì„±í•  ë¹ˆì˜ í´ë˜ìŠ¤ ëª…(ìë°” ì„¤ì • ì²˜ëŸ¼ íŒ©í† ë¦¬ ì—­í• ì˜ ë¹ˆì„ ì‚¬ìš©í•˜ë©´ ì—†ìŒ)
    • factoryBeanName: íŒ©í† ë¦¬ ì—­í• ì˜ ë¹ˆì„ ì‚¬ìš©í•  ê²½ìš° ì´ë¦„, ì˜ˆ) appConfig

    • InitMethodName: ë¹ˆì„ ìƒì„±í•˜ê³ , ì˜ì¡´ê´€ê³„ë¥¼ ì ìš©í•œ ë’¤ì— í˜¸ì¶œë˜ëŠ” ì´ˆê¸°í™” ë©”ì„œë“œ ëª…

item.title: Quick Start
item.description: Getting Started ğŸ˜ 1. Create a Gatsby site. If you are not using , following Gatsby Getting Started 2. Start developing. 3. Add your contentâ€¦
item.content:encoded:
Getting Started ğŸ˜

1. Create a Gatsby site.

# create a new Gatsby site using the blog starter
$ npx gatsby new my-blog-starter https://github.com/JaeYeopHan/gatsby-starter-bee

If you are not using npx, following Gatsby Getting Started

$ npm install -g gatsby-cli
$ gatsby new my-blog-starter https://github.com/JaeYeopHan/gatsby-starter-bee

2. Start developing.

$ cd my-blog-starter/
$ npm start
# open localhost:8000

3. Add your content

You can writeâ€¦

  • contents to blog in content/blog directory.
  • resume content/__about directory.

With markdown syntax and some meta data

Support script for creating new post

$ npm run post

4. Fix meta data

You can fix meta data of blog in /gatsby-meta-config.js file.

5. Publish with netlify

ğŸ’¡ if you want to deploy github pages, add following script to package.json

"scripts": {
    "deploy": "gatsby build && gh-pages -d public -b master -r 'git@github.com:${your github id}/${github page name}.github.io.git'"
}

:memo: Write a post!

content
â”œâ”€â”€ __about
â””â”€â”€ blog
  • You can register your resume on the web. (in __about directory)
  • You can register your post. (in blog directory)

ğŸ§ Customize!

Gatsby config

/root
â”œâ”€â”€ gatsby-browser.js // font, polyfill, onClientRender ...
â”œâ”€â”€ gatsby-config.js // Gatsby config
â”œâ”€â”€ gatsby-meta-config.js // Template meta config
â””â”€â”€ gatsby-node.js // Gatsby Node config

Structure

src
â”œâ”€â”€ components // Just component with styling
â”œâ”€â”€ layout // home, post layout
â”œâ”€â”€ pages // routing except post: /(home), /about
â”œâ”€â”€ styles
â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ code.scss
â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ dark-theme.scss
â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ light-theme.scss
â”‚   â””â”€â”€ variables.scss
â””â”€â”€ templates
    â”œâ”€â”€ blog-post.js
    â””â”€â”€ home.js

Style

You can customize color in src/styles directory.

src/styles
â”œâ”€â”€ code.scss
â”œâ”€â”€ dark-theme.scss
â”œâ”€â”€ light-theme.scss
â””â”€â”€ variables.scss

Welcome to gatsby-starter-bee! Happy blogging! ğŸ‘»

item.title: Welcome Bee starter
item.description: Welcome, Gatsby! This starter is full-package for your new blog! 1. Support Four frontmatter title date category draft 2. Code highlightingâ€¦
item.content:encoded:
Welcome, Gatsby! This starter is full-package for your new blog!

1. Support Four frontmatter

---
title: 'Welcome Bee starter'
date: 2019-2-6 16:21:13
category: 'development'
draft: false
---
  1. title
  2. date
  3. category
  4. draft

2. Code highlighting

  1. With Fira Code font
  2. Support highlighting with prism 2-1. Use inline highlighting
import React from 'react'

const TEMPLATE = 'gatsby-starter-bee'
class Foo extends React.Component {
  handleClick = val => {
    if (val === 'bar') {
      return 1
    } else if (val !== 'zoo') {
      return 2
    }
    console.log(`clicked`)
    return 3
  }

  render() {
    return <div>Welcome, Gatsby, ${TEMPLATE}</div>
  }
}

code

3. Support Markdown (h2)

  1. With Noto Sans font
  2. Support header anchoring

h3

h4

h5

quote!

bold italic

4. Support emoji ğŸš€

Based on emojione ğŸ™

5. Support light/dark mode

6. Support social sharing feature

  1. Twitter
  2. Facebook

Bonus, Buy me a coffee button

Set, buyMeACoffeeId of gatsby-meta-config.js

7. Comments feature

You can add comments feature by selecting one of them.

  • Disqus
  • utterances

8. Support latex

Support latex rendering with katex plugin.

$$\prod_{i=a}^{b} f(i)$$

âˆi=abf(i)\prod_{i=a}^{b} f(i)âˆi=abâ€‹f(i)

9. Other features of this template

  1. You can add resume to /about
  2. Lazy rendering
  3. Scroll restoration
  4. Categorize posts
  5. Offline caching with service worker (based gatsby)
  6. Support GA(Google Analytics)

Letâ€™s Start! Go

item.content:encoded:
